metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3764 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: A memory leak in the ccp_run_aes_gcm_cmd() function in drivers/crypto/ccp/ccp-ops.c in the Linux kernel allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption). It happens if function ccp_init_data(&src) returns error code (that is being called from the ccp_run_aes_gcm_cmd). It was discovered that the AMD Cryptographic Coprocessor (CCP) driver in the Linux kernel did not properly deallocate memory in some error conditions. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (memory exhaustion).

notes.Note: sbeattie> Red Hat asserts that the patch for CVE-2021-3744 contains the fix for CVE-2021-3764 as well.
